description: This file is a shell script used for populating the volatile filesystem during system initialization in an embedded Linux environment. It defines functions for creating files and directories, linking files, checking requirements, and applying configuration for setup of volatile data storage points. It handles system startup procedures related to the volatile filesystems, including cache management and applying configuration files for system setup tasks.

methods.name: create_file
methods.description: Creates a file at a specified path, either by touching an empty file or copying from a source, and sets ownership and permissions.

methods.name: mk_dir
methods.description: Creates a directory at a specified path and sets ownership and permissions.

methods.name: link_file
methods.description: Creates a symbolic link from a source to a destination, handling existing links or directories.

methods.name: check_requirements
methods.description: Validates system configuration, such as user and group definitions, required for applying configuration files.

methods.name: apply_cfgfile
methods.description: Processes a configuration file to create files, directories, links, and mounts as specified.
